ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: ability to think about ethical gray areas
I learned of the ethical dimensions in the scientific community and of many examples of unethical situations.

I was exposed to a variety of complex situations and had a chance to think about how I felt about them. I liked that this class had little right or wrong and served as a chance to expand our horizons and develop opinions.

This class allowed us to critically look at ethical issues in the scientific community which will always be relevant in our careers. In addition, it forced us to look at these situations through a very critical lens.
I learned a lot about ethical conducts.

I learned about the ethical considerations that one must be aware of in situations that are frequently encountered as scientists. I learned about situations where people clearly made the unethical decision and the consequences that resulted. Most importantly, I learned to develop how I think about these things so I can make the ethical choice if I ever find myself in one of these situations.
How to think critically about ethical issues in scientific research
I have got an insight of the field
How can scientists do bad things in their career's

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strenths - I liked the real world examples of the different ethical issues. I also liked the high level of class participation Weaknesses - for a pass/fail course, expectations were very high with regard to outside of class research. Even when I took the time to research the topics he asked us to, it still felt like he was angry because we didn't research it enough. That discouraged my participation.
The class teaches of the ethical dimensions of science to prepare us for our future careers. I did not feel that the students are treated in a way to encourage engagement.

I liked that it was discussion based and that there were know quizzes or anything. It made it easier to focus on engaging in the group conversation as opposed to being preoccupied with taking notes. I also thought the content was interesting and was presented through a series of interesting examples.

The open discussion format of the class was helpful. However, I think that the larger size of the class stifled the ability of quieter students to speak their opinions. The loud opinions of some students cut down the extent of discussions. I think it was consistently believed by the professor that a large number of students weren't speaking up because they weren't doing the reading or critically thinking about the situations. However, I think the problem more so is that a handful of students would consistently dominate the conversation without allowing other students to truly get their opinion in.
Quite well-organized and full of interesting topics.
I believe this course covered everything that it needed it. I think it could be improved by reducing the class size in order to better facilitate conversation/encourage participation.
It surveyed a wide variety of ethical issues, giving students the opportunity to think critically about many different topics
Hands out could be more organized
Every case study is very typical.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: it's required. But yes I think it's important to be exposed to this topic
This class is required and sets the necessary foundation for understanding the ethical dimensions of science.
yes, but this was just an ethics class. It was good for what it was and interesting.
I would as I believe it is important to critically think about ethical situations.
Yes.

Of course! This course provides far more than a checkmark necessary to join a graduate research group. The topics covered in this course are useful things to consider, as they are more frequently encountered than one might expect. By getting this exposure to these topics and gaining ethical awareness, it prepares students to be ethical scientists and researchers.
Yes, I think it is very important to take a course on ethics in scientific research, and this course did a great job in covering many different topics
